paragraphs.text: I sadly feel the same. I use my time off as time off, because trying to schedule actual projects around then just doesnt work. Plus cutting into my day job schedule is almost a rebellious act, for the purpose of personal growth/gain doubly so.
paragraphs.name: ec86

paragraphs.text: Thanks for observations and sharing. I am on same page. But I think freelancers can have routine too. Its upto individual how to utilise time. Living on ones own terms does not mean wandering everytime and do what you want, when you want. It could be doing what you love, not working for others and you can have your routine too. Co working spaces are great example of this.
paragraphs.name: 43b8

4d49a8459c0f.title: As long as your routine is built BY you rather than ‘for’ you, then I completely agree.

paragraphs.text: As long as your routine is built BY you rather than ‘for’ you, then I completely agree.
paragraphs.name: 43c9

6ce6e5bc8ab1.title: It’s fun to have that unstructured time for a day or two…but then I get bored as well.

content.subtitle: The trick with routines is to remember that they ARE NOT set in stone…change them when they need to be refreshed and they will bring order…

virtuals.subtitle: The trick with routines is to remember that they ARE NOT set in stone…change them when they need to be refreshed and they will bring order…

paragraphs.text: It’s fun to have that unstructured time for a day or two…but then I get bored as well. As a teacher so much of my life is regimented and scheduled and when I have time off for winter break or summer break I at first long for that unstructured time. But after a few days I find I’m just frittering my time away and I get that unsatisfied feeling.
paragraphs.name: 2b1a

336d38993139.title: Routine works best for most people out there, but some just like to tread a different path.

paragraphs.text: Routine works best for most people out there, but some just like to tread a different path. A kickass kick.
paragraphs.name: ad0b

6446a7b68119.title: I feel like I could write an article that is exactly the opposite of this.

paragraphs.text: I feel like I could write an article that is exactly the opposite of this. I always thought that routine was the awesomest. You didnt have to waste time and energy making decisions you just did what your routine said. It seemed peaceful. But when I tried it I realized, ‘yeah, jail would be peaceful too, but I don’t want to do it.” There is something…

3d4ee64a90da.title: I couldn’t agree more, great read!

paragraphs.text: I couldn’t agree more, great read!

3a3fbd30e265.title: This appears to be a very attractive way to work, but it doesn’t actually fit everyone at first.

paragraphs.text: This appears to be a very attractive way to work, but it doesn’t actually fit everyone at first. Just as routines take a while to get used to, so does not having a routine.
paragraphs.name: 621a

paragraphs.text: Love this as well. After spending some time with my 5 year old nephew this past fall, I really appreciate the value of routine. He’s set in his, as I am in mine and it’s welcome and familiar and dare I say — awesome?! We could all learn from applying the 5 year old routine and curiosity about life to our everyday.
paragraphs.name: 43b1

be6d84595ba3.title: I don’t think that routine has anything to do with working for somebody else or not.

paragraphs.text: I don’t think that routine has anything to do with working for somebody else or not. I’m a freelancer and I love my routine because yes it helps. I agree with that. But my routine allows me to go to the supermarket when it’s empty and get work done at night when it’s quiet and I can concentrate.
paragraphs.name: 82db

2365efec7e85.title: Routine Isn’t Boring… It’s Key To Living Better

content.subtitle: I recently took two weeks off from my day job. Why? Well, besides feeling burnt out, I was curious about how the everyday would feel…

virtuals.subtitle: I recently took two weeks off from my day job. Why? Well, besides feeling burnt out, I was curious about how the everyday would feel…

paragraphs.text: Routine Isn’t Boring… It’s Key To Living Better
paragraphs.name: f3c5

paragraphs.text: Exellent article! 👏

de9c71ec73d8.title: yes, routines are beneficial but so is flexibility and being freelance allows for both.

paragraphs.text: yes, routines are beneficial but so is flexibility and being freelance allows for both. however, being freelance and adhering to routine requires a mindset or personality that can self-govern; one that doesn’t require an authority beyond self to put structure to one’s life. freelance is strictly for those with a strong self-authority and…

Totally needed to read this. Waking up at 6am has been real difficult lately, going to my day job, and longing for that freelance life. But you’re totally right, routine keeps us crazy humans contained and focused. Thanks ;)
dang. i love this. i feel the same sort of pressures too. but i also have come to the same conclusion as you
paragraphs.name: a159

content.subtitle: Don’t you think that if you decided to quit your daily job to, p.e., start a new career in freelance photography, you will be busy as hell…

virtuals.subtitle: Don’t you think that if you decided to quit your daily job to, p.e., start a new career in freelance photography, you will be busy as hell…

paragraphs.text: I think that your feeling of loneliness\uselessness was stricly linked to the fact you were, obviously, on a “2 day off”.

paragraphs.text: Don’t you think that if you decided to quit your daily job to, p.e., start a new career in freelance photography, you will be busy as hell setting up your new biz, e-commerce, website, social media…

paragraphs.text: I love routine. Every week adding new things… that are sustainable…. really makes me feel like I have my shit together! It’s a slow progress forward, right?! Xoxo
paragraphs.name: 3a15

11113a09232b.title: I was misled by the same notion.

content.subtitle: If it’s something you love, routine isn’t bad at all.

virtuals.subtitle: If it’s something you love, routine isn’t bad at all.

paragraphs.text: I was misled by the same notion. But in the last few months I have filled my life with a few small routines. Like practising the Piano. Reading. Workout. Even a single episode of Seinfeld during dinner. The results are starting to show, and I feel great!
paragraphs.name: 1c53

paragraphs.text: So true!
paragraphs.name: 1be1

paragraphs.text: Love this!
paragraphs.name: 30e9

4b40a053c91f.title: This is a really nicely written little tidbit I have to say.

paragraphs.text: This is a really nicely written little tidbit I have to say. But I can’t help but disagree in some ways. I’m a freelancer ‘solotrepeneur’ (I love that btw) running my own business from home and I can definitely see where you are coming from with some of your points. However I find the lack of routine liberating in a way, and I feel a lot more at ease…
paragraphs.name: 6af0

9372e6801741.title: A huge amount of what we do every day is habit. You just felt lost without your habits.

paragraphs.text: I AM a freelancer who can and does goof around all day :) But I have habits, carefully cultivated, that keep me productive (between 9am and 2pm anyway)

b8317a6ac2f4bb1336deaec398e5032e.title: Routine Isn’t Boring… It’s Key To Living Better

b7a15238d70985c3cb9fe8e37d0bdb67.title: Routine Isn’t Boring… It’s Key To Living Better

2f1de09ba123669edf587de170e0edfa.title: Routine Isn’t Boring… It’s Key To Living Better

5515956e7c567b6aa042bdb2db804e5b.title: Routine Isn’t Boring… It’s Key To Living Better

paragraphs.text: The Internet makes you feel like routine is boring. And that the only life worth posting and tweeting and writing about is the freelance, “solotrepeneur” life. But it’s not.
paragraphs.name: f9cf

paragraphs.text: I won’t bore you with the intricacies of my two-week sabbatical, but what I will say is that I expected it to be revolutionary. I expected it to show me that I could be productive and happy and content at home or working from my local coffee shop with no set hours. And, as nice as it was to not have to do my hair or get properly dressed for two weeks, I felt lost.
paragraphs.name: b656
